description: Calculate the duration of the blue loops for the accretor models.
instructions: Using the MESA outputs with the same parameters as the paper (Z = 0.0019, initial period P = 100 days, and initial masses (M1, M2) = (18, 15), (20, 17), (38, 30) M☉), evolve the accretor models and calculate the duration of the blue loop phases in years for the two lowest mass accretors. The blue loop is defined as the excursion to hotter temperatures after beginning to ascend the Hayashi track. Return the durations in years for the two lowest mass accretors.
output_justification: From Section 3: 'In the two lowest mass models, this results in a blue-loop, which last ∼ 10^5 years.' This applies to the two lowest mass accretors.
